p.s: The short speech Remarks of president Barack Obama at student roundtable, given by (ex-)president Barack Obama in Tophane, ana town in Istanbul, at the Culture and Arts Center of Mimar Sinan Fine Arts University, is about the importance of intercultural understanding and student exchanges.
The President is speechingspeaking to young people and students from America and also to the people of Muslim world.
The given speech can be subdivided in introduction, main part and conclusion.
The introduction are ll. 1-3, the main part are ll. 4-17 and the conclusion is in the lines from 18-22.
In the Introductionintroduction Obama says, that he wants to rebuild the relationship between the United States and Muslims (ll. 1-3).

In the main part Obama is talking about, that he's proud to see new spirit of responsibility and activism take root, he's proud about the young people, which provide energy on the idealism of the idea of going forward (ll. 4-7).
He says everywhere he goes, there are people that are passionated and deeply informed about the whole world around them (ll. 7-8).
As a president, he wants that more students are going abroad, he wants new ways, to connect the whole world (ll. 9-12).
He says, that it would break down walls all around the world and he wants to start now with it (ll. 13-17).
In the conclusion he gives an appellappeal to all the muslims that are hearing the speech at the moment there (ll. 18-22).
The president starts with an introduction to give the audience a little introduction in his ideas.

The president trystries to take muslims and students into his boat, he wants that more students go abroad, because he wants that the United States and the world of Muslims rebuild theretheir relationship, he thinks that it would break down walls (ll. 9-11, ll. 1-3, ll. 13-14, ll. 4-8).

He also wants to rebuild the relationship with saying, that the Muslim people can always reach out for the United States (ll. 18-22), he says that they can make the world to a better place (ll. 18-22).
The president is choicing very often some pronouns like us/we, so that the audience feel connected with him and his ideas.
He makes hope, so that the people also become hope and really excited in his ideas (ll. 18-22).

In the beginning he not just spoke to the turkeyTurkey audience, he also speakspeaks to all Muslims and students abroad the world (ll. 1-3), he not just wants to change the relationship between the USA and the muslims, he wants to change the whole world (ll. 18-22).

In the Endend he says, that the United States are a friend, he does it, because he wants that the audience feels connected with him, but also he wants that the USA is the centre of the idea (ll. 21-22).
